Key Match Events: Marco Jansen hit the winning six
Kagiso Rabada took his first over after the halfway stage
Aiden Markram became just the second South Africa spinner to bowl four successive overs
Pre-Game Insights: Markram took the new ball in this match, and bowled himself for a full quota of four overs. He decided to rely on a non-traditional strength: spin.
Between them, South Africa's spinners took 5 for 79 in 12 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa have survived a rain-reduced match and successfully chased a tricky target to book the spot in the semi-final of the men's T20 World Cup 2024.
There's a new-found tenacity to them and it's seen them get to a T20 World Cup knockout for the first time in a decade.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa dropped four catches during the match.
Chase added eight more runs and then slog swept Keshav Maharaj to deep midwicket where David Miller could not contend with the aerial ball and let a difficult chance slip.
Rabada had played 62 T20Is before this one and had bowled in the first four overs in 61 previous instances.
He has once before been introduced after the halfway stage, in the 11th over in IPL 2021.
Others: Anrich Nortje dropped a potential run-out chance when Chase was on 12.
Heinrich Klaasen provided the game-changing passage of play when he took on Gudakesh Motie and broke the back of the chase to put South Africa on course for victory.
